data.event: Concepcion started as a small village founded in 1570 by the Spanish colonization forces led by Martin de Goiti and Juan de Salcedo, upon orders from then Spanish Governor-General of the Philippines, Miguel Lopez de Legazpi.

event.title: 2 July 1907, during the American colonization of the Philippines, Concepcion was elevated

data.event: On 2 July 1907, during the American colonization of the Philippines, Concepcion was elevated to municipal status but was incorporated as part of Mindoro province after Romblon was abolished and incorporated as part of Capiz province.
However, on 10 March 1917, Romblon was reinstated as a separate province, and thus, Concepcion was incorporated back to the province.

event.title: 8 June 1940, the special municipality of Maghali was established

data.event: On 8 June 1940, the special municipality of Maghali was established upon passage of Commonwealth Act No. 581 (authored by Congressman Leonardo Festin).

event.title: 26 May 1946, the special municipality was abolished

data.event: On 26 May 1946, the special municipality was abolished through the passage of Republic Act No. 38 (authored by Congressman Modesto Formilleza), and by 1 January 1947, Concepcion regained its municipal status which it still holds today.

event.title: authored by Congressman Modesto Formilleza), and by 1 January 1947

data.event: On 26 May 1946, the special municipality was abolished through the passage of Republic Act No. 38 (authored by Congressman Modesto Formilleza), and by 1 January 1947, Concepcion regained its municipal status which it still holds today.

On 26 May 1946, the special municipality was abolished through the passage of Republic Act No. 38 (authored by Congressman Modesto Formilleza), and by 1 January 1947, Concepcion regained its municipal status which it still holds today.
